definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He complained there weren't even any hot showers or flush toilets.
sentences.chinese: 他抱怨连热水浴跟抽水马桶都没有。

sentences.english: Install a flush toilet with small pondage.
sentences.chinese: 安装一个贮水量小的抽水马桶。

sentences.english: A low-flow showerhead and low-flush toilet save water.
sentences.chinese: 低流量淋浴喷头和低冲量抽水马桶可节水。

sentences.english: She would never sit on public toilets.
sentences.chinese: 她决不用公用坐式抽水马桶。

sentences.english: A toilet training system is installed upon a conventional toilet.
sentences.chinese: 一种排便训练系统被安装到普通的抽水马桶上。

definition: chamber pot/wooden pan used as toilet/toilet bowl
washbowl/basin for washing hands and face
Turkish toilet/squat toilet/to vacate one's bowels
